description: Test your knowledge of fashion history, trends, and iconic designers

questions.question: Who invented the 'little black dress'?
questions.funFact: Vogue magazine called the little black dress 'Chanel's Ford' because, like the Model T, it was accessible to women of all classes!
questions.story: In 1926, Coco Chanel published a simple calf-length black dress in Vogue. It was designed to be long-lasting, versatile, affordable, and accessible to the widest market possible. Vogue called it 'the Ford' of dresses, predicting it would become 'a sort of uniform for all women of taste'.

questions.question: Which designer first introduced the 'New Look' in 1947?
questions.funFact: The 'New Look' used almost 20 yards of fabric for a single dress, shocking people during post-war rationing!
questions.story: Christian Dior's 'New Look' revolutionized fashion after World War II. The style featured rounded shoulders, a cinched waist, and a full skirt, contrasting sharply with the fabric-conserving styles of the war years. It represented a return to luxury and femininity in fashion.

questions.question: What material was the first pair of Levi's jeans made from?
questions.funFact: The original Levi's were called 'waist overalls' rather than jeans!
questions.story: In 1873, Levi Strauss and Jacob Davis patented the first blue jeans, using canvas tent material. They later switched to denim, a sturdy fabric from Nîmes, France (hence 'de Nîmes' becoming 'denim'). The copper rivets, added to strengthen potential weak points, became a signature feature.
